title.narrative: SOCIAL BEHAVIOR CHANGE FOR CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Traditional and religious leaders, parents and communities, including adolescents in target areas, have increased knowledge and capacity for the adoption of practices and behaviours conducive to birth registration, protection of children against abuse, violence and exploitation and abandonment of child marriage, including in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Evaluation, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially the most vulnerable, including girls and those in humanitarian situations, are protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and child marriage within their families and communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Traditional and religious leaders, parents and communities, including adolescents in target areas, have increased knowledge andcapacity for the adoption of practices and behaviours conducive to birth registration, protection of children against abuse,violence and exploitation and abandonment of child marriage, including in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: La mobilisation communautaire pour mettre fin aux pratiques traditionnelles néfastes, telles que le mariage des enfants, les mutilations génitales féminines et autres VBG, a été renforcée grâce à des efforts conjoints avec d&39;autres agences (UNFPA, PNUD et ONU Femmes) et aux synergies internes avec les secteurs de l&39;éducation, WASH, la communication externe et la C4D autour du résultats clés 6 sur le mariage des enfants. En dépit de la situation humanitaire, ce sont 74 886 adolescentes sur 75 960 ciblées qui ont eu des capacités renforcées pour être agent de changement et contribuer à mettre fin au mariage des enfants.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
